headline: How Strong Q4 Results, AI Push And Buybacks At ServiceNow (NOW) Have Changed Its Investment Story
summary: ServiceNow recently reported strong Q4 2025 results and Q1 2026 guidance, highlighting accelerating subscription growth, expanded AI partnerships and acquisitions, and a new US$5.00 billion share repurchase authorization alongside leadership moves including Danielle Fontaine’s appointment as Chief Accounting Officer. These developments reinforce ServiceNow’s push to embed AI across its workflow platform and signal management’s confidence through both capital deployment and insider share...

headline: JPMorgan Flags 'AI-Resilient' Software Names After Selloff
summary: Fears that artificial intelligence (AI) will rapidly disrupt software companies have been overdone, according to JPMorgan. The bank’s strategists believe parts of the sector are more resilient than believed, creating a potential opportunity for investors. “Given the positioning flush, overly bearish outlook on AI disruption of software and solid fundamentals, we believe the balance of risks is increasingly skewed towards a rebound,” said Dubravko Lakos‑Bujas, Head of Global Markets Strategy. In

headline: Palantir Is Latest Tech Firm to Move Headquarters to Miami
summary: Miami has been attracting firms and wealthy business executives since the outset of the pandemic drawn by a mix of low taxes, good weather and relatively safe streets.  Since Citadel’s big move in 2022, finance companies and tech companies such as Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. have opened or expanded offices.  ServiceNow Inc. has committed to opening an office in West Palm Beach.

headline: ServiceNow CEO Is Buying $3 Million of Stock. Executives Cancel Planned Sales.
summary: ServiceNow  is setting an example for other hard-hit software companies.  CEO William McDermott plans to buy $3 million of stock in the open market, while he and other key executives are canceling planned sales of the shares, the company said in a securities filing.  ServiceNow stock now is down about 30% this year and off 50% from its high last summer of $211.

ServiceNow stock now is down about 30% this year and off 50% from its high last summer of $211.

headline: ServiceNow AI Deals And Leadership Shift Raise Questions On Valuation Gap
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) has entered new AI-focused partnerships to expand its enterprise workflow solutions. The company plans to acquire Pyramid Analytics for AI-powered business analytics. Two additional deals for Armis in AI cybersecurity and Veza in AI workflow capabilities are expected to close soon. ServiceNow has appointed Danielle Fontaine as Chief Accounting Officer, signaling a leadership transition. ServiceNow, known for its workflow automation and enterprise software platform, is...

headline: Dan Ives Calls AI-Driven Software Selloff 'Most Disconnected Trade,' Says Salesforce And ServiceNow Are Historic Buys
summary: On Friday, Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said Wall Street is misreading the impact of artificial intelligence on enterprise software. AI Disruption Fears Spark Software Rout Speaking on CNBC's "Closing Bell," Ives said investors are pricing in an unrealistic scenario in which AI tools rapidly replace traditional software platforms. "The most disconnected trade I've ever seen in my career on Wall Street," Ives said, referring to the sharp pullback in large-cap software stocks. Don't Miss: The AI Marke

headline: 2 Profitable Stocks on Our Watchlist and 1 We Ignore
summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.
